premises: If deforestation increases, then biodiversity decreases
conclusions: If biodiversity does not decrease, then deforestation does not increase
incorrect conclusions: If biodiversity decreases, then deforestation increases
If biodiversity does not decrease, then deforestation increases
If deforestation does not increase, then biodiversity does not decrease

premises: If pollution rises, then water quality falls
conclusions: If water quality does not fall, then pollution does not rise
incorrect conclusions: If water quality falls, then pollution rises
If water quality does not fall, then pollution rises
If pollution does not rise, then water quality does not fall

premises: If climate change progresses, then global temperatures rise
conclusions: If global temperatures do not rise, then climate change does not progress
incorrect conclusions: If global temperatures rise, then climate change progresses
If global temperatures do not rise, then climate change progresses
If climate change does not progress, then global temperatures do not rise
